other_tests.findings: Tuberculous meningoencephalitis diagnosed based on CSF findings; cultures negative for mycobacteria.
Cultures of inflammatory joint fluid were negative for bacteria and fungi; WBC count <10,000 cells/mL.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Symptoms at the right knee worsened after 2 weeks of therapy, and articular pain and local swelling at the left knee were observed.

other_tests.findings: Necrotizing granulomatous process with acid-fast bacilli detected.

other_tests.changes_over_time: Control bone marrow biopsy revealed remission of granulomatous features after 5 months of therapy.

other_tests.findings: Altered signal areas with peripheral enhancement indicative of a colliquative abscess of the left knee.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After initial improvement, the patient developed fever again and a new abscess was cultured.
